intro: Struthanthus uniflorus, commonly known as the one-flower struthanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces a single, showy yellow flower that blooms in late spring or early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine, soft hairs. Struthanthus uniflorus thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in desert or arid environments.
